title.content: Managed Template Messaging System Enhancement: Strengthening Message Data Pipeline Visibility

content.content: The existing managed messaging feature did not support certain message types and could not track sending status by team, making it difficult to understand overall operational status. This resulted in insufficient operational visibility, requiring improvements to ensure collaboration efficiency and operational stability.
Improved template registration functionality and internal sending logic to support more message types.
Designed automatic tagging during message sending using the `x-forwarded-for` header.
Implemented monitoring of sending status by country, team, and message type via Superset dashboard.

Enhanced the completeness of the managed messaging feature and built a new data pipeline from header collection, tag storage, to visualization, securing operational visibility. As a result, improved data usability and operational efficiency for the chat team, as well as reusability for other teams.

title.content: Semantic Caching Implementation: 25% Annual LLM Cost Reduction via Vector Search

content.content: Frequent LLM calls for sentence recommendation in secondhand trading chat were projected to cost approximately ₩900M annually. Although an intern, I proactively proposed semantic caching techniques first and directly implemented them to explore cost-saving measures.
Embedded real chat data and identified semantic conversation pattern clusters using PCA and HDBSCAN.
Used an add-on structure separated from the main server and embedded vector DB to prevent external traffic migration.
Load testing identified network I/O bottlenecks, addressed with lightweight multi-replica configuration (TPS 100/instance, P50 400ms, P95 under 1s) for concurrency handling.
Reduced annual LLM call costs by over 20%, with projected savings of over ₩230M.

title.content: LangGraph-based Prompt Evaluation and Improvement Automation Agent PoC

content.content: Evaluating prompt quality is difficult to quantify with consistent criteria due to the natural language characteristics. This makes it time-consuming and costly, relying only on repetitive manual comparisons. A system is needed to objectively score and automatically improve across various situations with consistent criteria.
Configured three sub-graphs with LangGraph and designed an automated evaluation-improvement loop.
PlannerGraph: Dynamically extracts evaluation criteria from system prompts and defines test scope by generating personas and scenarios.
ActorGraph: Simulates persona-based requests to generate responses and automatically produces scores and feedback according to derived criteria.
ReflectorGraph: Determines improvement necessity from evaluation results, rewrites prompts as needed, and implements operational-level continuous improvement by incorporating human feedback loops.

Provided a repeatable loop for quantitatively evaluating and automatically improving prompts across multiple scenarios. Confirmed improvement effects through cross-validation between models and explored the possibility of expanding into quality management infrastructure for prompts themselves.

title.content: SHAP-based Interpretable Churn Prediction Modeling PoC by Chat Session

content.content: Chat data is not just text; it contains time-series language and behavioral signals. Conversation churn manifests as continuous disruption of these signals. Existing simple churn prediction models make it difficult to understand when and under what circumstances users churn.
Extracted message embeddings using BERT/DistilBERT and calculated language signals such as sentiment, politeness, and closing intent.
Integrated metadata such as response time, message length, and reaction presence, inputting them into a sequence encoder (Transformer or LightGBM sequence-extended).
Used SHAP to analyze each feature's contribution to churn probability, designing the system to make churn likelihood at specific message points interpretable.
Predicted churn probability at each point and secured interpretability, enabling proactive intervention and response strategy formulation.
